00001 // Dawn Entry Point
00002 // Main function is the entry point of the kernel.
00003 
00004 #include <multiboot.h>
00005 #include <version/kernel_version.h>
00006 #include <common.h>
00007 #include <stdlib.h>
00008 
00013 int main(struct multiboot* mboot, uint32 stack_ptr /* Pointer to the stack pointer */)
00014 {
00015     //The kernel SHOULLDD now init fine, and think its in the magical land of the higher half
00016 
00017     #if defined(DEBUG_MODE)
00018         //Needs the multiboot location to function, 1 signals that the init routines should be noisy and cover the screen in stuff
00019         initializeKernel(mboot, 1, stack_ptr);
00020     #else
00021         initializeKernel(mboot, 0, stack_ptr);
00022     #endif
00023 
00024     printf("Dawn - Kernel initialized\n");
00025 
00026     printf("Kernel Codename: \"%s\" Version: %i.%i\n", KVERSION_CODENAME, KVERSION_WHOLE, KVERSION_FRACTION);
00027 
00028     //Run whatever the kernel is designed to do after initialization
00029     postInitialization();
00030 
00031     for (;;) {  } 
00032 
00033     return 0xDEADBABA;
00034 }
